content: v st chain 1 double_crochet in the last chain-1 space photo 5 turn your work rounds 4 - 20 as written round 21 chain 4 double_crochet in the first chain-1 space photo 1 v st in each v st photo 2 make a corner in the chain-2 space v st in each v st up to the last chain-1 space photo 3 v st in the last chain-1 space photo 4 turn your work round 22 chain 4 v st in the first v st photo 1 v st in each v st make a corner in the chain-2 space v st in each v st except the last one v st chain 1 double_crochet in the last v st photo 2 turn your work rounds 23 26 as written round 27 chain 1 single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in the first chain-1 space photo 2 chain 3 photo 3 and slip_stitch into the third chain from your hook photo 4 this is your first picot made double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in the next chain-1 space photo 5 * single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in the next v st make a picot double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in the next v st repeat from * 22 times photo 6 this should put you just before the point of the shawl where your 2 v stitches would usually be separated by a chain-2 space your next picot should straddle the point of the shawl photo 1 keep going with the same repeat 24 times you should now have 2 chain-1 spaces left double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in the next chain-1 space make a picot double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in the last chain-1 space photo 2 you will now continue around the base edge working around the horizontal posts of each round * single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in the same space as your last single_crochet photo 3 double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet around the next post photo 4 repeat from * down the length of the base edge finishing in the same space as you started round 26 in with a double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet photo 5 finish off and work away your tails of yarn optional bead round place 49 beads on your crochet thread single_crochet in each of the first 3 stitches single_crochet in the first chain of the picot photo 1 single_crochet in top of the picot but right before finishing the stitch slide a bead up photo 2 thread over and finish the stitch photos 3 and 4 single_crochet in the last chain of the picot this is where you slip stitched to make the picot continue in this manner until your last picot photos 5 and 6 finish with a single_crochet in each of the last 3 stitches and finish off braids cut 3 lengths of yarn about 30 long 3 for each side if you are feeling reckless you can add more with the right side of the scarf facing you insert your hook from back to front at one of the end points double your 3 strands so
